intro: Psychotria vasquezii, commonly known as the Ecuadorian Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in the understory of rainforests. Psychotria vasquezii is notable for its potential ethnobotanical significance, though its ecological role and chemical properties remain under study.
